SimpleJsUnit Javascript test framework by Anders Nygaard

Intro

SimpleJsUnit is a test framework for Javascript. It includes a testrunner and a bookmarklet for running tests with a push of a button from your browser. It is meant to be simple, yet powerfull. SimpleJsUnit relies on a bookmarklet testrunner, but you could also run tests from console or a custom application. More in the doumentations to follow.

Getting started

Add references

In your page header, add a reference to SimpleJsUnit and the testrunner: 
<script type = "text/javascript" src = "simplejsunit-1.1.0.js"></script>
<script type = "text/javascript" src = "simplejsunit.testrunner-1.1.0.js"></script>

Write some tests

tests.add("TestGroupName", function () {
    assert.fail("");
});

Add the boomarklet and run your test

Add this bookmarklet to your browser's bookmarks toolbar and run your test:

Run tests in solution

Asserts

Classic asserts

Asserts looks like this: 
assert.fail("message goes here");
SimpleJsUnit supports the following asserts: throwsException, isTrue, isFalse, areEqual, areNotEqual, isNull, isNotNull, isInstanceOfType, isNotInstanceOfType, fail

Fluent asserts

Fluent asserts looks like this: 
that(_somevar_).should().beTrue("message goes here");
SimpleJsUnit supports the following fluent asserts: throwException, beTrue, beFalse, beSameAs, notBeSameAs, beNull, notBeNull, beInstanceOf, notBeInstanceOf, fail

Types

IsInstanceOfType, IsNotInstanceOfType, beInstanceOf and notBeInstanceOf all require a type for comparison. Type, in this case, is a string and valid types are: string, boolean, number, function, object, array, regexp, date

Setup and teardown

Setup

The setup function runs every time before a test is run: 
tests.setup.add("TestGroupName", function () {
    persons = new Array();
});

Teardown

The tearDown function runs every time after a test is run: 
tests.tearDown.add("TestGroupName", function () {
    persons = null;
});

Running tests

From code or console

Run tests from console like firebug or from code with the following code: 
tests.run();
When the tests are run an object is returned. It looks like this: 
Object { numberOfTests=2, run=2, passed=0, failed=2, output="tests(0) - Age should be of type stringtests(1) - This test is supposed to fail", time="2 ms" }

With testrunner

Add the bookmarklet to your favourites toolbar and push it. The bookmarklet determines if the test framework is loaded and adds jQuery in order to present the tests. Drag this link to your favourites toolbar to install the bookmarklet:
